channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Why the stakes for who caught Ohtani's 50/50 ball are bigger than ever
item.description: The auction for Shohei Ohtani's iconic 50/50 baseball is almost over. But three men are still fighting in court over who will get the proceeds.
item.content:encoded:
The auction for Shohei Ohtani's iconic 50/50 baseball is almost over. But three men are still fighting in court over who will get the proceeds.

(Image credit: Goldin Auctions)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Boeing union is set to vote on a new contract deal, possibly ending strike
item.description: The latest proposal includes a 35% general wage increase over four years — bringing it closer to the union's original ask for 40%. Boeing previously offered a 25% raise over the life of the contract.
item.content:encoded:
The latest proposal includes a 35% general wage increase over four years — bringing it closer to the union's original ask for 40%. Boeing previously offered a 25% raise over the life of the contract.

(Image credit: Jason Redmond)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Frozen waffles sold at Walmart, Target and supermarkets are recalled over listeria risk
item.description: The recall includes various certain frozen waffles sold in Walmart, Target, Publix and other stores. Some waffles for brands like Kodiak Cakes, Simple Truth and Food Hold have also been recalled.
item.content:encoded:
The recall includes various certain frozen waffles sold in Walmart, Target, Publix and other stores. Some waffles for brands like Kodiak Cakes, Simple Truth and Food Hold have also been recalled.

(Image credit: TreeHouse Foods)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Cuba's power grid collapses again. Why does this keep happening?
item.description: Cuba's power grid has ground to a halt for a second time in as many days, leaving 10 million on the island without power and the Caribbean island in a growing sense of crisis.
item.content:encoded:
Cuba's power grid has ground to a halt for a second time in as many days, leaving 10 million on the island without power and the Caribbean island in a growing sense of crisis.

(Image credit: Ramon Espinosa)
item.dc:creator: Emily Green

item.title: A drone targets the Israeli prime minister's house during new barrages with Hezbollah
item.description: Israel said a drone targeted the prime minister’s house; there were no casualties. Hezbollah said it carried out rocket attacks on Israel, while Israel launched airstrikes on Beirut's suburbs.
item.content:encoded:
Israel said a drone targeted the prime minister’s house; there were no casualties. Hezbollah said it carried out rocket attacks on Israel, while Israel launched airstrikes on Beirut's suburbs.

(Image credit: Hussein Malla)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Opinion: 'YER OUT!' Eric Adams' fashion faux pas
item.description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams, no stranger to controversy, has ignited another with a hat. NPR's Scott Simon explains.
item.content:encoded:
New York City Mayor Eric Adams, no stranger to controversy, has ignited another with a hat. NPR's Scott Simon explains.

(Image credit: Frank Franklin II)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Who was Yahya Sinwar, the Hamas leader killed by Israel?
item.description: A look back on the life and politics of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, a key player for the last several years in the Israel-Gaza conflict.
item.content:encoded: A look back on the life and politics of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, a key player for the last several years in the Israel-Gaza conflict.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: The killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar may escalate war in Lebanon
item.description: The future of Hamas and the war in Gaza now that the organization's leader is dead.
item.content:encoded: The future of Hamas and the war in Gaza now that the organization's leader is dead.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: U.S. cybersecurity chief says election systems have 'never been more secure'
item.description: Jen Easterly, director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, told NPR that election officials across the U.S. have made big improvements to bolster both physical and cyber security.
item.content:encoded:
Jen Easterly, director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, told NPR that election officials across the U.S. have made big improvements to bolster both physical and cyber security.

(Image credit: Patrick Semansky)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Trump is promising deportations under the Alien Enemies Act of 1798. What is it?
item.description: Former President Donald Trump says if reelected, he will invoke a centuries-old law to expedite the removal of undocumented immigrants. Can he? Here's what to know about the Alien Enemies Act of 1798.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump says if reelected, he will invoke a centuries-old law to expedite the removal of undocumented immigrants. Can he? Here's what to know about the Alien Enemies Act of 1798.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
